WordPress.Security.NonceVerification.Mis.message: Processing form data without nonce verification.
WordPress.Security.NonceVerification.Mis.ai_guidance: Before adding nonce verification, check if the calling function already performs nonce verification. Avoid duplicate nonce checks in nested functions. Use @security phpcs:ignore WordPress.Security.NonceVerification.Missing -- Nonce verified in calling function to exempt when already handled.

WordPress.Security.NonceVerification.Rec.message: Processing form data without nonce verification.
WordPress.Security.NonceVerification.Rec.ai_guidance: Consider if nonce verification is needed for this GET/REQUEST usage. Check calling context before adding verification. Use @phpcs phpcs:ignore WordPress.Security.NonceVerification.Recommended -- Safe GET parameter usage to exempt when appropriate.

WordPress.DB.DirectDatabaseQuery.NoCachi.message: Direct database call without caching detected. Consider using wp_cache_get() / wp_cache_set() or wp_cache_delete().
WordPress.DB.DirectDatabaseQuery.NoCachi.ai_guidance: Before adding caching, determine if this function/method is called multiple times in a single page load or if the calling function already implements its own cache management. Only add wp_cache_get/set if the query is actually repeated. Use @phpcs phpcs:ignore WordPress.DB.DirectDatabaseQuery.NoCaching -- Single execution or cached by caller to exempt when appropriate.
